snippet.textDisplay:
​@Psydrre Hey dude. We're May 29th 2019 and we're only at VGM 2292! 
So 2292 - 1630 = 662 videos in 1737 days
Which makes 1 video every 2.6238 days.
2738 - 2292 = 446 videos left
446 * 2.6238  = 1170 days

Let's talk again on Aug. 11th 2022!
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Best VGM 01 was posted 2 september 2007, which makes that about 2550 days ago. 2550  divided with 1630 (videos so far) gives us and average of 1,56 days pass before we get a new video. 2738 - 1630 gives us 1108 more videos until we reach the video in question. Taking the earlier number of days passed before a new vid, we would hear/see number 2738 in about 1728 days, or at may of 2019. Very rough math though!
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Best VGM 01 was posted 2 september 2007, which makes that about 2550 days ago. 2550  divided with 1630 (videos so far) gives us and average of 1,56 days pass before we get a new video. 2738 - 1630 gives us 1108 more videos until we reach the video in question. Taking the earlier number of days passed before a new vid, we would hear/see number 2738 in about 1728 days, or at may of 2019. Very rough math though!

snippet.textDisplay: I posted 2 tracks from Equinox, but now it's time for its prequel to shine thanks to another awesome track by Tim Follin. The short peaceful intro making way for sudden crazy arpeggios and percussions is always a nice surprise. The game itself was alright, but it's far from a favorite of mine (the same goes with Equinox). I haven't finished it.
snippet.textOriginal: I posted 2 tracks from Equinox, but now it's time for its prequel to shine thanks to another awesome track by Tim Follin. The short peaceful intro making way for sudden crazy arpeggios and percussions is always a nice surprise. The game itself was alright, but it's far from a favorite of mine (the same goes with Equinox). I haven't finished it.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky Actually surprised you hadnt posted this one before. I never played the game but Tim Follin is one of my favourite console composers. Weird fact, he actully hates console music. 

BTW, do you have the Turok 2 (GBC) Cemetery Stage song in your list? Its one of my favourites.

snippet.textDisplay: My parents bought me Solstice when I was a kid and I remember being blown away by this tune, vastly superior to anything I had heard until then (which admittedly was not that much). I remember playing it for a long time and eventually clearing it and feeling satisfied about it. Then again, it's not the eighties any more. I don't think that a game whose main challenge is trying to figure out the perspective would draw much attention.
snippet.textOriginal: My parents bought me Solstice when I was a kid and I remember being blown away by this tune, vastly superior to anything I had heard until then (which admittedly was not that much). I remember playing it for a long time and eventually clearing it and feeling satisfied about it. Then again, it's not the eighties any more. I don't think that a game whose main challenge is trying to figure out the perspective would draw much attention.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't think it counts as a "prequel" when it came out first, it's just the first one.  Incidentally, do the games actually share a story, or was Equinox more of a "spiritual" sequel (as the phrase seems to go)?  I've never been clear on that one.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't think it counts as a "prequel" when it came out first, it's just the first one.  Incidentally, do the games actually share a story, or was Equinox more of a "spiritual" sequel (as the phrase seems to go)?  I've never been clear on that one.

snippet.textDisplay: Tim Follin is an absolute god among composers who worked with limited hardware.  He is easily in my top 5 composer who worked with limited hardware.  This title theme is pretty good.  I really like it a lot.
snippet.textOriginal: Tim Follin is an absolute god among composers who worked with limited hardware.  He is easily in my top 5 composer who worked with limited hardware.  This title theme is pretty good.  I really like it a lot.
